questions.question: Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: MySQL cursor is by default asensitive.
An insensitive cursor performs faster than an asensitive cursor.

questions.question: Which index maintenance task discards the entire index and recreates it?
Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: MySQL removes the temporary table automatically when the session ends or the connection is terminated.
A temporary table is only available and accessible to the client that creates it.
A temporary table can have the same name as a normal table in a database.
MySQL does not support Temporary Table.

questions.question: Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: WITH CHECK OPTION in view is applicable only for updatable views.
Different views can be created on the same table for different users.
A view can hide the complexity that exists in a multiple table join.
We cannot use WITH CHECK OPTION while creating a view.

questions.question: What is a complex view?
options: A view that is created from only one table
A view that is created from more than one table
A view that does not contain groups of data
A view that is used to update the data in the tables used to create the view

questions.question: In MySQL, if you would like to throw your own exceptions, you can do so by changing SQLSTATE using ______ keyword.
What is the difference between a PRIMARY KEY and a UNIQUE KEY?
options: Primary key can store null value, whereas a unique key cannot store null value.
Primary key has unique and not null values, whereas a unique key has only unique values.
Primary key cannot be a date variable whereas unique key can be.
Primary key has unique values whereas a unique key has unique and not null values.

questions.question: Which of the following function returns the current date and time?
Identify the correct statement from the following:
options: LIKE clause can work with only one operator %.
LIKE clause cannot work with operator _.
LIKE clause can work with two operators % and _.
LIKE clause can work with two operators % and ?.

questions.question: The names of columns can be altered in a query’s results by using the ______ keyword.
How many Primary keys can we have in a MySQL table?
Which of the following is the correct IF statement syntax?
To get all the rows that are common in both tables based on the condition specified, use:
Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: When compared to relational databases, NoSQL databases are more scalable and provide superior performance.
Non-relational databases require that schemas be defined before you can add data.
NoSQL databases are built to allow the insertion of data with a predefined schema.
SQL Server is a type of NoSQL Database.

questions.question: For which of the following MySQL triggers are not supported?
Which of these tasks can you accomplish using SQL as a DML?
options: Inserting a record into a table
Allowing a new user access to read data from a table
Removing a column from a table

questions.question: Which of the below is not a valid TCL command?
How can a constraint be placed on a table where a field will contain the value “Rohan” if nothing is provided?
options: CREATE TABLE People (FirstName TEXT CONSTRAINT Rohan, address TEXT, city TEXT);
CREATE TABLE People (FirstName TEXT DEFAULT 'Rohan', address TEXT, city TEXT);
CREATE TABLE People (FirstName TEXT DEFAULT (Rohan), address TEXT, city TEXT);
CREATE TABLE People (FirstName TEXT DEFAULT = 'Rohan', address TEXT, city TEXT);

questions.question: Which syntax is followed by MySQL for stored routines?
Which column attribute enables the generation of sequential numbers automatically for identification?
Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: In MongoDB, field names cannot start with the dollar sign ($).
In MongoDB, field names cannot contain dot (.) character.
BSON documents cannot have more than one field with the same name.
BSON is a serialization format encoding for JSON.

questions.question: Identify the wrong statement from the following:
options: Primary Key cannot hold NULL values.
Unique Key can hold NULL values.
A Primary Key in a table can be referred to as a Foreign Key in another table.
One or more fields can be declared as a unique Key.

questions.question: Which of the below is not a MySQL Storage Engine?
A query that is executed inside of another query is called a ______.
What does OPEN cursor_name statement do when working with cursors in MySQL?
options: Fetches the next row for the SELECT statement associated with the cursor

questions.question: When you use SQL statements to create or modify the structure of a database, SQL is being used as:
Which of the following command is used to insert data into collection in MongoDB?
When you use an aggregate function without a GROUP BY clause, how many results do you expect?
options: All the records in a table

questions.question: What will be the output of the join query?
Which operator is used to test whether or not a value lies within a specified range?
A relation is said to be in ______ if it is in 2NF and no transitive dependency exists.
Which of the following is not a NoSQL database?
How are transactions handled within a database?
options: Failed operations are ignored and the transaction continues.
Failed operations are flagged for review at the end of the transaction.
If any operation fails, the entire group of operations is deleted from the database.
If any operation fails, the entire group of operations fails.

questions.question: To iterate the cursor and return more documents, which keyword in the Mongo shell is used?
The standard user and application program interface (API) of a relational database is the:
Which of the following is a wrong statement?
options: A subquery can be nested within another subquery.
We can use subquery in clauses such as SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.
A MySQL subquery is called an inner query while the query that contains the subquery is called an outer query.
A subquery cannot return more than one value.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a foreign key?
options: Foreign keys are the unique identifier for a table.
Foreign keys refer to the primary key in another table to link the two tables together.
Foreign keys refer to a foreign key in another table to link the two tables together.
Foreign keys are used to update a row in a table.

questions.question: What is the latest SQL Server version?
Which code returns only the columns pgcode, pgdata, pgdesc from the data table?
options: SELECT pgcode, pgdata, pgdesc FROM data;
SELECT pgdata, pgcode, pgdesc FROM data;

questions.question: Identify the correct statement from the following:
options: We cannot use WHERE clause with DELETE command.
TRUNCATE command deletes all rows of a table in one go.
DELETE command is comparatively faster than TRUNCATE command.
In case of DROP statement, we can restore the table using ROLLBACK.
